content: I noticed recently that every platform under std::os has its corresponding raw module (and all contained items) deprecated, thanks to the RFC at https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/blob/master/text/1415-trim-std-os.md . But shortly after that RFC was implemented someone added haiku support, and I think they simply didn't realize that they shouldn't be adding a raw module. the haiku-related items all appear to be exposed by the libc crate. would it be worth submitting a PR to deprecate that module and bring it in line with all the others?
